results.title: Atoms for peace (Sweden)
results.brief_description: Shows how Sweden, though it is a small country, has become a world leader in the peaceful uses of atomic energy. Examples and advantages of nuclear power generation for the production of electricity and heat and use of radioactive isotopes for industry and medicine are presented. No other credits available.

results.title: Atoms and starlight
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
The use of spectroscopy and spectrum analysis have been vital when astronomers study the stars. The continous, emission and dark-line spectra have enabled scientists to determine the composition of stars and to modify the original classification of stars. Atoms of elements have their own unique “fingerprint’ spectrum which can be determined by studying the behaviour of photons and electrons. With the advances in fibre optics, spectographs can now measure many stars instead on one, and thus determine the nature of a group of celestial bodies within a galaxy.

results.title: Atoms and molecules
results.brief_description: Sir Lawrence Bragg describes and illustrates the structure of atoms and molecules, demonstrates their size and the progressive development of microscopic instruments and techniques, and performs experiments showing the wetting of oil molecules and the Brownian movement. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.description: Sir Lawrence Bragg describes and illustrates the structure of atoms and molecules, demonstrates their size and the progressive development of microscopic instruments and techniques, and performs experiments showing the wetting of oil molecules and the Brownian movement. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Atomisation
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit and Bill Mason
results.brief_description: Atomisation is defined as the breaking up of liquids into minute drops for efficient burning or economical spreading. Different methods of atomising liquids; scent spray; centrifugal spinning cup plus air blast; pressure jet. Slowed movement illustrations (150X) show how atomisation occurs. Main uses: agricultural and for burning liquid fuel. Various methods of qualitative and quantitative evaluation of spray patterns. Testing jet aircraft atomizers.

results.title: Atomic structure and correlations within the Periodic Table
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Andrew Patterson, Jr and David G. Anderson
results.brief_description: The first episode of this film looks at atomic structure and the Periodic Table, and the second episoe looks at correlations with the Periodic Table. Using a blackboard size Periodic Table from which individual elements can be removed or placed at will, this film illustrates a method of using the Periodic system to determine the electronic structure of atoms. Suitable for Upper-Secondary students.

results.title: Atomic power and the U.S.
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Atoms for Peace”.
This film examines the United States’ nuclear energy programme for the production of electric power; five types of nuclear reactors designed by U.S. Government laboratories and American industries; nuclear plants operated and financed by private industry. Atomic fuel and technical skills developed by intensive research in the United States are available to other countries through international agreement. No other credits available.

results.title: Atomic physics: an historical approach
results.brief_description: A five part series designed for use in agencies teaching advanced physics. This series traces the development of atomic energy from when John Dalton forwarded his atomic energy theory in 1808. Through reconstruction and interviews, the scientists Dalton, Faraday, Rutherford, Cockcroft, Frisch and Einstein are introduced. Each part of the series is usable independently.

results.title: Atomic medicine
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Burton Benjamin, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Among the peaceful uses of the atom is the application of atomic radiation in medical research, diagnosis and treatment. Radiation “tagging and tracing” is a valuable technique in ascertaining the sizes and shapes of various glands such as the thyroid. Treatment of cancers in localized regions of the body is one of the most effective deterrents of the disease. This film points out how continuing research hopes to improve on methods now in use.
